description: The Biden administration vowed more strikes against Iran’s forces and its proxies in the Middle East after three straight days of punishing attacks, even as senior officials insisted the US won’t be pulled into a prolonged regional conflict.
title: US Promises More Mideast Strikes While Trying to Avert Wider War

description: A group of House conservatives opposed Speaker Mike Johnson’s new standalone $17.6 billion Israel aid package because it isn’t fully paid for with offsetting spending cuts, signaling that Democratic support for passage will be needed.
title: House Conservative Group Opposes Speaker’s Israel-Only Bill

description: Turkey said Vladimir Putin is expected to visit soon, in what would be the Russian leader’s first trip to a NATO-member country since he ordered the invasion of Ukraine two years ago.
title: Putin to Visit Turkey in First Trip to NATO Country Since War

description: Harvard University brought on Kenneth C. Frazier, the former chief executive officer of Merck & Co., and KKR & Co. Co-CEO Joseph Y. Bae to its governing board.
title: Harvard Names Ex-Merck CEO Frazier, KKR’s Bae to Its Board

description: The first contest of 2024 with Joe Biden’s name on the ballot gave Democrats some tentative signs of strength among the Black voters crucial to his reelection campaign.
title: Biden’s South Carolina Result Quells Concerns About Black Vote

description: On top of tumbling stocks, an embattled property market and a struggling economy, there’s at least one more thing keeping domestic Chinese investors up at night: a potential win by former US president Donald Trump in the November general election.
title: Trump 2.0 Tops Chinese Investors’ Concerns, Goldman Sachs Says

description: Turkey’s Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan on Sunday signaled a preference to retain Russian air defenses which Washington wants Ankara to ditch if it wants to buy F-35s fighter jets.
title: Turkey Signals Preference to Retain Russian S-400s in F-35 Row

description: Senegal lawmakers will examine a bill Monday to extend President Macky Sall’s mandate until the next elections amid a proposal to postpone the February 25 polls for six months.
title: Senegal Lawmakers to Vote to Extend President Sall’s Mandate

description: GOP presidential contender Nikki Haley took fresh jabs at party frontrunner Donald Trump’s legal troubles, age and recent gaffes on Sunday, hours after her surprise appearance on Saturday Night Live in which she mocked his refusal to debate her.
title: GOP’s Haley Takes Fresh Jabs at Trump’s Age, Legal Challenges

description: One of Indonesia’s three presidential candidates said he would review job creation laws, in the final televised debate ahead of the Feb. 14 vote.
title: Indonesia Presidential Rivals Bore Down on Labor in Last Debate

description: A top Senate negotiator laid out key details of bipartisan border legislation ahead of its expected release on Sunday, outlining new asylum rules she said would slash the release of migrants into the US.
title: Senate Border Deal Would Speed Asylum Review, Limiting Releases

description: Canada has lengthened a ban on foreign home buyers for two additional years as the country’s real estate market begins to show signs of a rebound, stoking concerns about the cost of shelter in cities like Toronto and Vancouver.
title: Canada Extends Ban on Home Purchases by Foreigners Through 2026

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will travel to Northern Ireland to meet with political leaders after the restoration of the devolved government in Belfast after a two-year hiatus.
title: Sunak to Visit Northern Ireland After Restoration of Government

description: Former President Donald Trump said he might impose a tariff on Chinese goods of more than 60% if elected, signaling an increasingly hawkish tone against the top supplier of goods to the US.
title: Trump Floats Chinese Goods Tariff of More Than 60% If Elected

description: The Group of Seven and the European Union are discussing a plan to use more than $250 billion in frozen Russian central bank assets as collateral to help fund Ukraine’s reconstruction, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: G-7 Eye Russian Assets as Collateral to Raise Funds for Ukraine

description: Key Biden administration national-security officials traveled to Guyana on Sunday as the US works to prevent the country’s dispute with Venezuela over oil and mineral riches from sliding into armed conflict.
title: Biden Officials Headed to Guyana Amid Dispute Over Oil Wealth

description: House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries echoed the White House in criticizing a Republican plan to vote on a stand-alone $17.6 billion Israel aid package, while saying his party’s lawmakers would consider the bill.
title: Democrats Will Consider Israel-Only Aid Bill, House Leader Says

description: An agreement to pause the Israel-Hamas war and free civilian hostages captured by Hamas isn’t imminent and “the ball is in Hamas’s court,” US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said.
title: Israel-Hamas Hostage Release Deal Remains Elusive, Sullivan Says

description: Nangolo Mbumba was sworn in as Namibia’s president on Sunday following the death of Hage Geingob, who passed away earlier in the day.
title: Mbumba Sworn In as Namibia’s President After Death of Geingob

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party is delaying plans to scrap the House of Lords as it nails down its policy platform ahead of a general election expected this year, the Financial Times reported.
title: Labour Party Delays Plans to Abolish House of Lords, FT Says

description: El Salvador’s Nayib Bukele expects to ride a wave of voter support for his anti-crime policies to a second term in Sunday’s election, even as rights groups criticize mass arrests and abuses of civil liberties that have occurred on his watch.
title: El Salvador’s Crime Crackdown Pushes Bukele Toward a Second Term

description: Voter support for Germany’s far-right AfD is at its lowest since July, continuing a slow downward trend since a “re-migration” plan with Nazi echoes was recently uncovered, triggering mass protests.
title: Germany’s Far-Right Support Slips to Lowest in Seven Months

description: Hello again. Here’s what we’re talking about heading into the new week.
title: New Strikes on Houthis, Big Oil Earnings: Sunday UK Briefing

description: China vows to maintain capital market stability and will resolutely prevent abnormal market fluctuations, the securities regulator said Sunday as the country’s stock selloff deepened.
title: China to Prevent Abnormal Market Fluctuations, CSRC Says

description: Enap, Chile’s state-owned energy company, halted operations at its second-biggest oil refinery after wildfires caused power cuts.
title: Chile Halts Second-Biggest Oil Refinery After Fires Cut Power

description: Iranian-backed Houthis vowed to respond to US and British-led airstrikes after dozens of targets of the Yemen-based rebel group were struck overnight.
title: Houthi Rebels Vow New Attacks After Latest US, UK-Led Strike

description: Northern Ireland could hold a referendum about leaving the United Kingdom to join the Republic of Ireland within the next decade, according to Michelle O’Neill, the first nationalist to become first minister.
title: Northern Ireland’s O’Neill Says Unification Vote Possible in a Decade

description: The US stepped up criticism of Kosovo’s crackdown on the use of the Serbian currency, which included seizing a vehicle transporting social benefit payments for the members of nation’s Serbian minority.
title: US Slams Kosovo for Unnecessarily Raising Ethnic Tensions

description: The departure of the Royal Navy aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth to lead the largest Nato exercise since the Cold War has been cancelled at the last minute after an "issue" with a propeller shaft was spotted during final checks.
title: Royal Navy Aircraft Carrier Cancels Sailing After Propeller Issue

description: Egypt’s Suez Canal revenue plunged by almost half in January, a top official said, after attacks by Yemeni militants on Red Sea vessels forced major shipping firms to avoid the waterway.
title: Egypt’s Canal Receipts Fall by Almost Half After Red Sea Attacks

description: The Philippine government will use its “authority and forces” to stamp out any attempt to separate the country, its national security adviser said following a threat by former leader Rodrigo Duterte to split his native Mindanao from the rest of the nation.
title: Philippines to Use ‘Forces’ to Quell Secession Attempts, Official Says

description: Euro-zone leaders looking to keep populist parties at bay are unlikely to get much help from the economy this year — even if the European Central Bank cuts interest rates.
title: Europe’s Leaders Can’t Count on 2024 Vote Boost From Economy

description: Namibia’s President Hage Geingob, who served as the country’s first post-independence prime minister, has died. He was 82.
title: Hage Geingob, Namibia’s President Since 2015, Dies at 82

description: New laws designed to stop Australian bosses from contacting their workers after hours aim to limit the amount of unpaid overtime for staff, Employment Minister Tony Burke said Sunday, adding the government was consulting business groups over the proposed change.
title: Australia Minister Says Planned Laws Aim to Curb Unpaid Overtime

description: North Korean beauty products such as false eyelashes and wigs are being sold around the world as “Made in China,” aiding a recovery in its economy, Reuters reported.
title: North Korean Eyelashes Sold Globally as China-Made, Reuters Says

description: The global oil market is looking increasingly local as militant attacks in the Red Sea and surging freight rates make supplies from closer to home more attractive.
title: Red Sea Danger Is Spurring Global Oil Buyers to Go Local

description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said the US’s military action in the Middle East over the weekend has been proportionate, and reinforced his support for a two-state solution for Israel and Palestine.
title: Australia Says US Action in Middle East Is ‘Proportionate’

description: President Joe Biden cruised to victory in South Carolina’s Democratic primary, a vote that tested his support among Black voters and independents — and will impact Nikki Haley’s push to defeat Donald Trump in the Republican contest in three weeks.
title: Biden Racks Up Easy Win in South Carolina’s Democratic Primary
